intro: Calamus oblongus subsp. elongatus, commonly known as the long-stemmed arrowroot, is a species of flowering plant in the family Zingiberaceae. It is native to Southeast Asia, particularly found in regions of Indonesia and the Philippines. The plant is characterized by its long, slender rhizomes that can reach several meters in length. These rhizomes are rich in starch and are used as a food source in local cuisines. The plant also produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically yellow or green in color.
